Reviews.Title: Replacing my C810 with another C810
Reviews.Author: Joan W. Johnson "average reader"
Reviews.Content: I owned my original Pantech Duo C810 for about a year before dropping it in water and having it (rightfully) stop working. When looking at new phones to purchase, I was heartbroken not to find any with the double-slide keyboards that the Duo has - one number keypad for dialing and one letter keypad for texting and email. The Duo runs on Windows 6.1, which I find so user friendly and easy to understand. The Internet speed is acceptable for me, since I use my computer more than my phone for surfing the web. I just could not find another phone I wanted that equalled how much I missed my Pantech DUO, so I made the decision to order another exactly like my original -- and I'm glad I did. The phone arrived very quickly, it took just one phone call to my phone company to turn it on, and I'm once again a happy Pantech Duo C810 owner. I like everything about it simply because it's a good, basic, easy to use, user friendly phone. If you want fancy, fast, touch screen the Duo isn't for you. If you want simple, basic, and easy to use, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Windows Mobile phone.
Reviews.Author: QWERTY514
Reviews.Content: Ive been looking all over for a reasonably priced windows mobile phone. Purchased this one and couldnt be happier. Works great for all my needs. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: clumsy
Reviews.Author: R. Norman
Reviews.Content: This phone gets the job done but; It is very clumsy to use. The learning curve with this phone is huge. I would not recommend this phone to a new user. The qwerty keyboard is easy to use. This is probably the best feature of the phone. It works great on the AT&T; network.

Reviews.Title: wow my daughter <3s this phone
Reviews.Author: roberto
Reviews.Content: i know alot of people say its a smartphone but its not you dont have to pay extra and this is not flimsy it is the best phone for all of my daughters texting needs!!!! I would recomeend this to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great messaging phone .
Reviews.Author: C. steward
Reviews.Content: Even though this phone probably has as many good as quirky performance characteristics . It shines in text/multi-media abilities . It can be very difficult to obtain and enter the specific "proxy" info (sometimes required to establish connection with your service providers MMS servers ) , and can require a call to your service providers tech support guys to muddle through it with you ( good luck ! )Although my T-Mobile rep was incredibly helpful , knowledgeable , and patient , fowarding me an e-mail of the required settings for future reference . This handset was actually purchased as a back-up for the  C810 I regularly use . Why ? Because as three and four G phones become  "required" technology , really good QWERTY / messaging phones are growing scarce . So when my wifes Motorola Rival's keyboard excused itself from the rest of the phone , ripping the ribbon cable in half as it did so , I kinda thought it would be nice to have a direct replacement standby at the ready for my phone .

Reviews.Title: Don't Mess with Success
Reviews.Author: J. Osterman
Reviews.Content: This was my second Pantech dual slider phone and all this thing did was make me long for the old model.On the plus side the unit is lighter and slimmer.On the minus side it had a loose feeling, as though all the connections were not quite tight. That slight rattle was far from what I've come to expect from slider and flip phones that move smoothly and crisply.Second, the slide-out QWERTY keyboard feels almost flat. The keys are raised just a bit so, for me, it felt like I was typing on a flat surface. I prefer a little more substance on my phones.Finally, the phone is not intuitive. It took me about 10 minutes to figure out the camera feature. I'm used to and happier with a more streamlined menu.I think Pantech overthought themselves on this one.

Reviews.Title: Ok phone
Reviews.Author: phonekiller
Reviews.Content: First off this is a ok phone. the pros make up for this phones cons. So the first thing bad about it is the build quality. the phone makes creaking noises in your pocket when you move, the screen is also a little small to look at web pages and photos with, and the included internet browser is slow (download opera mini it is much faster). And then there are the pros. Even though the slider creaks it is durable and can take a beating before breaking, the dual keyboard is also nice and fairly easy to use, and the media player is good at playing media and the speaker does a nice job at playing music to. So now for the part that cell phone are actually made to do... calls, And I am happy to report that the duo makes very good calls, But the terrible camera makes up for that. So I give the duo 3.5 out of five stars

Reviews.Title: The phone was broken and they just ripped me off
Reviews.Author: Chavez
Reviews.Content: It did not charge at all and I couldn't do anything about it the seller was just a rip off.

Reviews.Title: Hate it!
Reviews.Author: A. Melton
Reviews.Content: There's not a day that goes by that I don't consider chucking this piece of junk into the garbage disposal (I have an amazing garbage disposal!).  It's a Window's phone, which works about as well as my Windows computer.  It constantly freezes up on me when I'm trying to compose a text message.  It seems to miss every 3rd letter typed, so I have to go back and retype areas of the text message that it missed the first time.  It's totally annoying and I can't wait until I'm eligible for a new phone.

Reviews.Title: Should really stay away from it...
Reviews.Author: NunoQuintas
Reviews.Content: Not the best phone ever, works fine but has 2 "little" problems.First, configuring the phone is a major pain... Every guide out there is pretty helpfull, unfortunatly, this phone menu system is different than all other aparently... So no luck there.Second, the phone turns off by itself... A LOT! Specially when connected to the computer USB, wich is unfortunate becaus the adapter supplied if for 110v, and I live in portugal, where we have 220v sockets.Other than those 2 things... It's a nifty little phone for the price asked.EDIT: 3-4 days after receiving the mobile, guess what. no longer charges, not even with the charger (wich I got an adapter for). Could be a good phone, but just does not cut it..

Reviews.Title: Great value for a super phone!
Reviews.Author: A H "happymallqueen"
Reviews.Content: This phone is perfect for my teenager!  It has the keyboard for texting and enough features to meet his needs.  Like the price too!

Reviews.Title: just like new
Reviews.Author: Gertie
Reviews.Content: My phone arrived shortly after I ordered it and it works like a brand new phone.  Great price for this phone.  I had one before and loved it so I was glad to find another.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: sue
Reviews.Content: This phone is great, lot of features, worth the money LOVE THE PHONE. I bought 2 of these phone for family and they loved it, i am thinking of getting one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Great Smile
Reviews.Content: We purchased this phone for our teenage son who dropped his other Pantech phone and broke it.  It was a seemless transition of just popping the card in and go!  The phone was easy for him to use and has held up nicely so far.  Sure beat going to the AT&T; store and starting over with a contract etc.  The delivery was quick as well.

Reviews.Title: yeah right
Reviews.Author: astas
Reviews.Content: I like the phone but can not see any picture messages!  I feel it was a waste of money

Reviews.Title: Not Unlocked
Reviews.Author: Frihet
Reviews.Content: The phone arrived in working order, clean and properly packed. It is, however, not unlocked (as advertised), so it cannot be used. I am now starting to see how to get it fixed, replaced, or returned.

Reviews.Title: Enjoy the dual keypad/keyboard feature
Reviews.Author: m0m2t0by
Reviews.Content: Purchased this item for my husband who doesn't know (or care to know) much about computers and hi-tech gadgets. I chose this phone particularly because of the dual keypad/keyboard feature. He is one who tends to send more text messages than make phone calls. He has been using this phone for about 3 weeks now and has figured out enough about the phone to create an e-mail account for himself. Great starter "smartphone" for those who may be techno-challenged. Since it has Window's Mobile for an operating system, it is also, in a sence, teaching him how to maneuver around a computer that runs Windows as an operating system. Only issue we have encountered is the lack of tech-support from the manufacturer. His is an unlocked version and we needed help configuring internet, and mfr. had no spec sheet in thier own database. Weird. We eventually got everything configured correctly thanks to several on-line blogs. Took some searching on our part, but found the right info and have been pluggin' along since.

Reviews.Title: Pantech Duo
Reviews.Author: Cell Phone User
Reviews.Content: This cell phone works great. Easy to handle and easy to use. Would recommend it to any cell phone user.

Reviews.Title: Leonardo
Reviews.Author: Lisset
Reviews.Content: Por favor se me presento problemas con esta compra, no funciona el auricular y no hay solucion en venezuela, que debo hacer para un cambioGracias

Reviews.Title: Awful
Reviews.Author: indio
Reviews.Content: Returned phone for a refund or credit and never got an answer back.  Received phone thinking it was in very good condition.  But was in very poor condition.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: uhhh IDK
Reviews.Content: Had problems with the first phone delivered but its been 3 days and this phone seems to be doing great...THank you Mendy :)
